title: bootstrap: "download-ci-llvm = true" doesn't work on x86_64-pc-windows-gnu with lld

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

labels.name: S-blocked
labels.description: Status: marked as blocked ❌ on something else such as an RFC or other implementation work.

body:
You get an error like this:
```
   Compiling rustc_driver v0.0.0 (C:\msys64\home\we\rust\compiler\rustc_driver)
error: linking with `x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc` failed: exit code: 1
  |
...
  = note: ld.lld: error: duplicate symbol: vtable for llvm::FormalArgHandler
          >>> defined at librustc_llvm-a81737dd65a7c126.rlib(M68kCallLowering.cpp.obj)
          >>> defined at librustc_llvm-a81737dd65a7c126.rlib(PPCCallLowering.cpp.obj)
          collect2.exe: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```

I didn't investigate it further.

It never worked in the past and I assumed it's due to the old mingw version on CI, but it still doesn't work after https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/100178 and the actual error doesn't look like it's caused by a toolchain version.
